meanings.definition: A hidden or unsuspected danger or difficulty.
meanings.sent1: Navigating through life is full of pitfalls that we must be cautious of.
meanings.sent2: The project faced many pitfalls along the way, but we managed to overcome them.
meanings.sent3: The cartoon character comically fell into the pitfalls set by the mischievous villain.
meanings.sent4: In the journey of self-discovery, one must be wary of the pitfalls that may hinder growth.
meanings.sent5: The wise old owl warned the young birds about the pitfalls of trusting strangers in the forest.

meanings.definition: A covered pit used for trapping animals.
meanings.sent1: The hunter carefully set up the pitfalls to catch wild animals in the forest.
meanings.sent2: The villagers dug deep pitfalls to capture the pesky rodents causing trouble.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous raccoon managed to avoid all the pitfalls set by the trapper.
meanings.sent4: The ancient tribes used pitfalls to secure their food source in the harsh wilderness.
meanings.sent5: The cunning fox outsmarted the trapper by recognizing the pitfalls and avoiding them.
